Tom et all, I wondered about that, Barry states they are designed, in part ( If I read him right, slap me if not ) to help with the griping in the koiguchi but I wonder. would the abrasiveness not "file down" the wood of the saya over time, and probably faster that usual ?. adding to the gunk and oil and other bits and bobs collecting in the saya and possibly damaging a polish, particularly if fresh.

Rich
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Tom Helm 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Sunday, January 18, 2004 12:20 PM
  Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Cat scratches - yasurimei on habaki


  Folk-
        You know I think cat-scratch habaki are quite popular now but in fact 
  tend to rear up the koiguchi. I think CB was the one who told me 
  koshirae artists these days make tons of them but do not like them for 
  this reason...
  -t

  I have a silver cat scratch habaki and a tore up koiguchi, but that 
  could just be my draw...
